sentences.en: a sense of fancy and whimsy
Beautiful young people are the whimsy of nature, but beautiful old people are true wokes of art.
sentences.cn: 美丽的年轻人是大自然的奇想, 而美丽的老人却是艺术的杰作.

sentences.en: Gratify her every whimsy ; viewed from another perspective, that's loveliness, or evidence of her innocence.
sentences.cn: 陪她做一切她愿意做的也许很幼稚的事情,换个角度, 其实那叫可爱, 或者说像她一样有童心.

sentences.en: He had a whimsy about flying to the moon.
sentences.cn: 他有个想飞上月球的怪念头.

sentences.en: His speech was full of whimsy.
I must confess, I'm guilty of the same foolish whimsy.
sentences.cn: 我承认, 我和你一样干过这样的蠢事.

sentences.en: In this matriarchal city, males had a subservient role, and most answered to the whimsy females.
sentences.cn: 在这座女权主义的城市, 女性扮演者反复无常的角色, 她们大多数承诺完全是一时的心血来潮.

sentences.en: They are like oracular messages, but witty - jaunty at times - and sometimes trembling on the edge of whimsy.
sentences.cn: 它们都像神谕, 但很机智,有时极其轻快,有时又濒于怪诞.

sentences.en: Vintage caf é curtains in a graphic floral pattern add whimsy.
sentences.cn: 古典风格的带有生动花纹的窗帘如锦上添花.

sentences.en: Why did you do it?'' I do not know, pure whimsy.'
sentences.cn: 你怎样做出这种事来?'` 我也不知道, 纯粹是闹着玩儿.

sentences.en: Worse , the whimsy : car - owners can choose anywhere they want, not just where they live.
sentences.cn: 车主可以选择他们想要的区号, 不仅限于他们的居住地.

words.tran_cn: 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的
异想天开地；古怪地；反复无常的
奇想；一时的兴致；怪念头；幻想
异想天开；反复无常；怪诞的行为或想法

trans.tran_cn: 怪念头，异想天开，怪脾气，与众不同的幽默感
trans.tran_en: a way of thinking, behaving, or doing something that is unusual, strange, and often amusing
